document.docAuthor: Pastor, Catalina, Russo, Virginia Lo & Villares, Gabriela
document.docTitle: Parasaveljevia uncinoa Pastor, Russo & Villares, 2015, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Parasaveljevia Wieser, 1953 (Thoracostomopsidae, Nematoda) from Argentinean coasts (Chubut, Argentina)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Parasaveljevia Wieser, 1953 (Thoracostomopsidae, Nematoda) from Argentinean coasts (Chubut, Argentina)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Holotype Male, CNP-NEM N° 1115 , collected in winter,
13 /06/ 2006
on “Playa Pozo” beach (
42 º 49 ’ S
and
64 º 53 ’ W
), during low tide. This coastal area is characterized by rock outcrops forms easily eroded material as tuffs and siltstones. The specimens were collected from small tuff holes, covered by sediment and bordered with abundant
Polysiphonia brodiei (Dillwyn)
Sprengel, 1827
. Characteristics of surface sediment layer: mean particle size (Mean particle size, Q 2 = 0.22 ; Fine fraction, FF % = 1.11 ; SO index = 0.65 ; SK index = 1.50 ). This species was found together with several specimens of Patagonema iubatum Pastor et al., 2014 . Collector: Catalina Pastor.

Paratypes Six males and three females, same data as holotype mounted on slide numbers CNP–NEM N°
1116‒1117
;
1119‒1121
;
1124‒1127
.

Description. Holotype : Male. One dorsal and two ventro-sublateral lips, rounded in lateral view, with at least one incision on each lip. Two inner labial setae ( 9 µm long) inserted near apex of each lip, six in total. Two cirri rectangular in shape, 10 Μm long, inserted on the outer surface of ventro sublateral lips at the level of insertion of inner labial setae. Outer labial and cephalic setae situated at the anterior end of cephalic capsule. Six outer labial setae, 48 Μm long, and four cephalic setae all of the same length ( 25 Μm).

Reproductive system diorchic, testes opposed. Two spicules each 40 Μm long, arcuate, with velum, proximal end with well-developed cephalisation. Gubernaculum tubular, 3 Μm in width with dorso-caudal apophysis ( 22 Μm long). One tubular-globular supplement ( 10 Μm long) situated 83 Μm in front of spicules. Three precloacal (
Fig. 4
B, G 1 ) and two postcloacal (
Fig. 4
B, G 2 ) papillae present. Tail 170 Μm long (AD = 3.4 ), conical to cylindrical toward the distal end with swollen tip. Tip of the tail lacks setae.

Female. Similar to male in general body shape. Lateral mandibles slightly smaller than in males, with only two rows of denticles. Ventro-sublateral and dorsal teeth smaller than in males (
Fig. 3
C). Reproductive system didelphic amphidelphic, ovaries reflexed. Vagina short, not thickened. Tail 155 Μm long (AD = 3.68 ) without setae. Diagnosis and relationships.
Parasaveljevia uncinoa
n. sp.
is characterized by having a long rectangular cirri, positioned at the level of the inner labial setae; rectangular mandibles with prominent lateral hooks, bearing denticles in three (or two) lines of nine (or six) each and six cephalic setae of the same length, inserted at the anterior end of a small head capsule.

The De Man’s ratios of
P. uncinoa
n. sp.
and
P. cirrifera
Wieser, 1953
are similar, but the two species differ in the length of the cephalic capsule and shape of the mandibles.
Parasaveljevia uncinoa
has a greater number of denticles of different sizes on the mandibles, a smaller general body size, and shorter spicules, gubernaculum and tail than
P. cirrifera
.
Etymology. The specific name refers to the hooks found on lateral ends of mandibles. From the Latin word “uncino”.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2. Figure showing main characters that differ between genera
Oxyonchus
and
Parasaveljevia
. A. In apical view of
Oxyonchus
and Parassaveljevia ; B. In cephalic capsule (lateral view); C. In cephalic capsule (ventral view).

FIGURE 3.
Parasaveljevia uncinoa
n. sp.
Line drawings. A. Head in apical view of male paratype; B. Cirri and cephalic setae on anterior end of female paratype; C. Head and buccal cavity of female paratype; D. Cirri and cephalic setae on anterior end of male holotype; E. Head and buccal cavity of male holotype; F. Posterior end of male holotype; G. Posterior end of female paratype; H. Vulva and gonadal apparatus of female paratype; I. Copulatory apparatus, spicule, gubernaculum of male holotype. Scale bar: 1= 20 µm; 2= 100 µm.

FIGURE 4.
Parasaveljevia uncinoa
n. sp.
Micrographs of slide mounted specimens. A. Apical view male paratype; B. Cloacal aperture in subventral view of male paratype; C. Apical view male paratype. D. Head and buccal cavity of male holotype; E. Head and buccal cavity of male paratype, sensillae; F. Copulatory apparatus, spicule, gubernaculum of male paratype; G. Cuticularization of pharynx in male holotype; H. Head and buccal cavity of male paratype, ventro-sublateral tooth. Abbrev: VSlat MB= ventro-sublateral mandible; VSlat tooth= ventro-sublateral tooth; D tooth= dorsal tooth; Mb hook= mandible hook, G1= precloacal glands; G2= postcloacal glands. Scale bar: 1= 20 µm.

TABLE 1. Measurements (in Μm) of
P. limitensis
n. sp.
and
P. uncinoa
n. sp.
, including mean values (form: mean (range)). *Juvenile in fourth stage.
